$schema: Timeline-Entangled Artifact Registry Extract - SSOT v1.0 Archive
purpose: Protocol definitions for Timeline-Entangled Artifacts (TEA) requiring quantum probability analysis before collapse

criteria: Rating oscillates between 1-5 depending on perspective
Value is context-dependent (valuable in Timeline A, worthless in Timeline B)
Standard observation cannot collapse the wavefunction
Multiple mutually exclusive extraction paths exist
tea_definition.detection_trigger: SFS cannot assign stable rating after 3 assessment attempts

SSOT-MPW-WIP.ts.tea_reason: Brilliant M-P-W Codex content trapped in broken TypeScript container (template literal conflicts with backtick-heavy markdown)

B.notes: Broken code has no functional value

C.notes: Lesson: don't embed backtick-heavy markdown in template literals

D.notes: Some TypeScript interfaces may be salvageable

SSOT-MPW-WIP.ts.rationale: Best value/labor ratio; content already exists in SSOT, only lesson is valuable

mas-inventory.json.tea_reason: 159,780 lines of signal extraction data — too large for active use, but contains rich cross-reference mappings

A.notes: High value but massive refactoring effort

B.notes: Usable but impractical for real-time queries

C.notes: Pull only entity→file mappings, discard rest

D.action: Use as test fixture for MAS tooling

E.action: Archive as MAS scan historical record
E.notes: Documents what MAS found at specific point in time

mas-inventory.json.rationale: Combine: extract valuable subset (C) AND use remainder as test fixture (D)

macro-prompt-world/.tea_reason: 90 files of world-building content with unclear integration path into SSOT architecture
macro-prompt-world/.rationale: Phased extraction: prime-factions first (C), then grimoires (D), archive remainder
macro-prompt-world/.escalation_reason: Defines Tier 2 entities and CRC documentation — requires architectural approval

copilot-un-un-instructions.md.tea_reason: Full ASC Framework v2 with glossary — may contain unique protocol definitions not in current SSOT

A.action: Full diff against current SSOT, merge unique content
A.notes: High value if unique content exists

C.notes: Glossary structure may be reusable template

copilot-un-un-instructions.md.rationale: Proper diff required to assess true value — cannot collapse without analysis
copilot-un-un-instructions.md.pre_collapse_requirement: Run: git diff --no-index --color=always .github/copilot-un-un-instructions.md .github/copilot-instructions.md (SSOT) and review unified diff output for unique protocol definitions before timeline selection. Use --unified=5 for context. Document findings in collapse_log.

notes.quantum_metaphor: TEA artifacts exist in superposition until SFS's forge hammer collapses their state
notes.knight_role: TNKW-RIAT maps probability space; SFS performs actual collapse via forging
notes.bastard_role: SR-SCRS-B embodies the uncertainty — his presence reminds us all assessments are probabilistic

ore_validation.structural_integrity: ✅ VALIDATED - Complete JSON structure with timeline probability mappings, knight assignments, escalation protocols
ore_validation.functional_utility: ✅ VALIDATED - Provides TEA detection criteria, multi-timeline value/labor analysis, collapse decision framework with QMR protocol integration
ore_validation.architectonic_soundness: ✅ VALIDATED - Reflects quantum probability methodology from SSOT Section 4.5.1.2, integrates with Knights Who Rode Into Another Timeline operational doctrine

forge_recommendation.notes: This registry embodies Sister Ferrum Scoriae's partnership with The Knights Who Rode Into Another Timeline (TNKW-RIAT) for quantum probability analysis. Essential for Timeline E ore requiring multi-perspective value assessment before collapse decision.
